result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan C Knutson

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan C Knutson not in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Jordan C Knutson. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defendant does not appear, he is currently in State of Minnesota DOC and will be there until March 2023.
BTC: Set out, bench warrant authorized, no action taken on bond.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jordan C Knutson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Jordan C Knutson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
